resources.controller

Class PartInvScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.controller.PartInvScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class PartInvScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class is the controller of the "Add Part" and "Modify Part" UI.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        This method makes sure only one radio button is selected in the add or modify parts display and initializes the controller class
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - default
        rb - default

      • cxlPartWin

        void cxlPartWin(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method is used to cancel the window that allows the user to add or modify parts
        Parameters:

        Uses Methods:
        • MainScreenController.confirmActionAlert(String)

      • addOrModPart

        private void addOrModPart(java.lang.String methodUseIndicator,
                          com.jfoenix.controls.JFXButton btn)
        This method is called in addPart(MouseEvent) and modifyPart(MouseEvent) to update or add parts to the list of parts. Certain parts of this method are used depending on the task required.

        Uses Methods:
        • Inventory.addPart(Part)
        • Inventory.updatePart(int, Part)
        • MainScreenController.setNewNextNumInPartPkSequence(ObservableList)
        • MainScreenController.capFrstLetOfWords(String)
        Parameters:
        methodUseIndicator - Indicates to the method to run the code that is only necessary for the task required.
        btn - Which button is being clicked

      • addPart

        void addPart(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method calls addOrModPart(String, JFXButton) to add the part.
        Parameters:
        event - mouse click

      • modifyPart

        void modifyPart(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method calls addOrModPart(String, JFXButton) to modify the part selected
        Parameters:
        event - mouse click
